Data analysis on a Pokémon dataset

What's a Pokémon ?

Pokémons are little monsters created by Nintendo & The Pokémon Company. Each monster can have eaither one or two types, in a range of 18 types. As of today, there is 905 creatures that are created !
This is huge, and it also generates alot of data... There's still a meta created around it and people don't go often battling online with Pikachu, unfortunately.

Here's one on my favourite Pokémon

265
Wurmpl
Insect
Poison

Why did you do this ?

This is a homework made for my data visualisation class, using d3.js. Since I enjoyed training for a JavaScript course by building a basic Pokédex, I decided to do a real school project with this game's data. It was fun to do, and it was hard to find data about some of my favourite games, so I used the data of one of the most played one. (Since it was easier to find ;) Enjoy your visit !

Stats breakdown by type

What are stats ?

Statistics of pokémon define how they'll do in battle. They each have the same stats but distributed in a different way. Here, you can explore a breakdown of pokemon's stats by type, with a red line defining de median value.

Analysis of competitive tiers

A look into types and statistics

Explanations

Tiers are used to classify pokémons based on their power and their usage rate in battles. As cited by Smogon:

"The standards set by Smogon's tier system seek to balance competitive battling, ensuring no Pokemon is "too powerful" or over-centralizes the metagame it appears in."

In this page, you'll find a breakdown of each tier by types, with the 10 most used pokémon in each tier.
